DRAG DROP -
You manage the Microsoft Teams environment for a company.
You need to configure the system to ensure that users can view data from an external app within a Teams channel.
Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

choices.D: User1 has a data loss prevention (DLP) policy in place.
choices.C: User1 has a communication compliance policy in place.
choices.A: User1 has a Microsoft Information Protection policy in place.
choices.B: User1 has a Conditional Access session policy in place.

discussion.content:
Correct - Sensitivity labels from the Microsoft Information Protection solution let you classify and protect your organization's data, while making sure that user productivity and their ability to collaborate isn't hindered.

B - is applied at the App level - Question states, all users can share and download files
C - Communication compliance is an insider risk solution in Microsoft 365 that helps minimize communication risks by helping you detect, capture, and act on inappropriate messages in your organization
D - Data loss prevention (DLP) helps you prevent the unintentional or accidental sharing of sensitive information (using Sensitivity Labels) - DLP examines email messages / word document and files for sensitive information, like a credit card number.
isn't the answer a DLP policy?

questions.question_text:
You are managing the Teams environment for a tenant with Microsoft Cloud App Security (MCAS) enabled. All users of the tenant can share and download files via Microsoft Teams person-to-person (P2P) private chat.
.
User1 can share files but when trying to download files shared by colleagues, the notification The files didn't download appears in the bottom right corner of the screen.
You need to determine the cause of this issue.
What is the cause of this issue?

A ExamTopics company assigns Microsoft 365 E3 licenses to all users. The company configures a Conditional Access policy.
UserA initiates a one-to-one Microsoft Teams chat with UserB. UserA reports that they cannot share files with UserB. All other users within the company can share files in one-to-one chats.
You need to resolve the issue.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The only logical answer. Correct

choices.C: Check permissions and sign in access for UserA's OneDrive account.
choices.B: Assign UserA a Microsoft 365 E5 license to replace the E3 license.
choices.D: Turn off the Conditional Access policy for UserA.
choices.A: Disable and re-enable the SharePoint online license assigned to UserA.

questions.question_text:
User1 shares a Microsoft Word document with User2 during a Microsoft Teams chat session.
User2 is unable to make any changes to the document.
You need to determine the root cause of the issue.
What is the cause?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
sensitive labels helps with document sharing restriction and encryption. 
 D is the right answer

Selected Answer: D
Uncorrect answer. If sensitive labels were assigned on this file, it wouldn't be possible to even open it. Correct answer is D

Selected Answer: D
Labels can be applied to documents inside of Teams/SharePoint not via Chat - The question states, the document is shared in a chat sessions.

By default it will be View Only when a file gets uploaded and shared with people currently in the chat (Pluralsight Training)

Selected Answer: D
sensitive labels helps with document sharing restriction and encryption not edit the files so it's D

Selected Answer: D
I agree that applying sensitivity labels doesn't mean that another user can't edit the files so it's D

Selected Answer: D
The answers should be "D". Applying sensitivity labels doesn't mean that another user can't edit the files. In a Teams chat when a user sends a file, the owner of the document should make sure that edit permission is enabled.

choices.B: A sensitivity label has been applied to the shared file.
choices.A: User2 does not have a Microsoft SharePoint license.
choices.C: The Microsoft Office package is not activated on User2's device.
choices.D: User2 has view-only permissions for the document.

HOTSPOT -
You need to troubleshoot the Microsoft Teams performance. To answer select the appropriate options in the answer area.
:

NOTE -
Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: If 80/443 were closed then nothing else would work either. I don't see anywhere stating that ports 1024 to 2048 are used for Teams. 1024 to 2048 are used for AD though, but that shouldn't impact Teams. They only other answer is "Route audio and video traffic for Microsoft Teams using UDP ports"

When the 80/443 ports are closed, then it shouldn't work at all. The main issue here is that everything works slow and calls drop from time to time. The only possible answer for this question is : "Route audio and video traffic for Microsoft Teams using UDP ports"

I agree with second one, split tunneling should do the job

I don't agree with the first one. TCP80/443 are required but I'd expect symptoms to be different from what's described: chat shouldn't work at all instead of slowly if those ports are blocked.
Poor audio\video on the other hand is typical for blocked UDP ports. Hence "Route audio and video traffic through UDP" seems to be the correct answer.

Agree with split tunnel, even though not required to exempt it from a VPN tunnel, it's bad practice to route Teams through a VPN
